Test Case: Verify if the DNS records are configured properly.
Verify if DNS records do not point to 404 URLs.
Verify if the website has a valid SSL certificate.
Verify if there is no open port in the network.
Verify if the firewall is configured properly to restrict unauthorised access
Verify if the web application is able to identify spam attacks on contact forms used on the website.
Verify that all usernames and passwords are encrypted and transferred over secured connection like https.
Verify information stored in website cookies. It should not be in a readable format.
Verify application for SQL Injection.
Verify application for Cross Side Scripting.
Verify application for HTML script injection attacks.
Verify that directory browsing is disabled on the server.
Verify that rate limiting is enabled in login forms.
Verify all HTTP methods. PUT and Delete methods should not be enabled on a web server.
Verify if special characters, HTML tags, and scripts are handled properly as an input value.
Verify if the error pages are displaying any information that can be helpful for a hacker to enter into the system.
Verify that sensitive data is not passed in URLs while communicating with different internal modules of the web application.
Verify WiFi network security.
Try to exploit all servers, desktop systems, printers, and network devices.
Verify if incoming network traffic is scanned to find Trojan attacks.
Verify if system or network is secured from DoS (denial-of-service) attacks.
Verify that all applications and database versions are up to date.
Verify that all dependencies are up to date.
Verify memory leak and buffer overflow.
Verify against spoofing attacks.
Verify if any critical data like the password is stored in secret files on the system.
Verify if the application is returning more data than it is required.
Verify previously found vulnerabilities to check if the fix is working.
Verify the use of registry entries. Sensitive information should not be kept in the registry.
Verify against COM & ActiveX attacks.
Verify that application is preventive against canonicalization attacks
Verify that there should not be any hardcoded username or password in the system
Verify that network traffic is monitored by proxy appliances
Verify that all files must be scanned before uploading them to the server
Verify all input fields with long input string with and without spaces
Verify URL manipulation to check if a web application is not showing any unwanted information
Verify that binary file does not consist of any sensitive information
Verify that discretionary ACL is working correctly
Verify code disassembling like performing algorithm reversing, analysis of security updates and patching binaries
Verify that application is preventive when attempt to modify execution flow for instance serial key validation
Verify that application is safe from Brute Force Attacks â€“ a trial and error method to find sensitive information like passwords
